Parameters.Name: 2.1.3 NETWORK COMMAND SETHOSTNAME TEST ERROR CASE

Test.TestName: NETWORK COMMAND SETHOSTNAME TEST ERROR CASE
Test.Name: Expected Fault (InvalidArgVal/InvalidHostname). Initial FromDHCP=false
Test.Description: Check NVT NETWORK COMMAND SETHOSTNAME TEST ERROR CASE test when DUT return correct response (FromDHCP = false, Name = HOSTNAME). GetHostname(false, HOSTNAME) SetHostname(Fault) GetHostname(false, HOSTNAME)

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
DEVICE-2-1-3 NETWORK COMMAND SETHOSTNAME TEST ERROR CASE
STEP 1 - Get Hostname Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Check that the DUT returned current hostname information STEP PASSED
STEP 3 - Set Hostname - negative test Transmit done Receive done SOAP fault returned Code: Sender Subcode: InvalidArgVal Subcode: InvalidHostname Reason: System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException: MESSAGE at DUT.CameraWebService.Device10.DeviceServiceFake.StepTypeProcessing(StepType stepType, SoapException ex, Int32 timeOut) in D:\!ONVIF\DUT\Version2\DUT\CameraWebService\ServiceDevice10\DeviceServiceFake.asmx.cs:line 61 at DUT.CameraWebService.Device10.DeviceServiceFake.SetHostname(String Name) in D:\!ONVIF\DUT\Version2\DUT\CameraWebService\ServiceDevice10\DeviceServiceFake.asmx.cs:line 455 STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Get Hostname Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Check that current hostname returned from the DUT STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Verify that hostname has not been changed Expected: HOSTNAME, actual: HOSTNAME STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Verify that FromDHCP has not been changed Expected: False, actual: False STEP PASSED
TEST PASSED
